definition: to keep for use/to retain sth/to keep sb in his job
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: He inherited Flor on first coming to the St. Gregory.
sentences.chinese: 他一到圣格雷戈里饭店就留用了弗洛拉。

sentences.english: When they reorganized the company, they made a clean sweep of all the holdovers .
sentences.chinese: 当他们重新改组公司时，撤换了所有的留用人员。

sentences.english: He's incompetent and not worth keeping on.
sentences.chinese: 他庸碌无能，不值得留用。

sentences.english: The seniority of retained laborers will be inherited and acknowledged by the new employer.
sentences.chinese: 其留用劳动者的工作年资，应由新雇主继承予以承认。

sentences.english: The new employer shall recognize the prior period of service of those workers to be retained.
sentences.chinese: 其留用劳工之工作年资，应由新雇主继续予以承认。

sentences.english: I am so circumstanced that I cannot keep him.
sentences.chinese: 我处境使我无法留用他。

definition: to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
to appoint/to assign
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to put in an important position
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
to employ/to hire
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
excess personnel/superfluous staff
to dismiss/to discharge/to fire
to disband/to dismiss/demobilization
to resume a post
to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
to demote (to a lower rank)
